Name: Lundarbók / Codex Reenhielmianus / LundUB Mh 15 / Medeltidshandskrift 15
Form of Initials: Ornamented, often inhabited large (6-8 lines), medium (4-5 lines) and small initials (2-3 lines). Large initials and a number of medium initials are historiated.
Iconography: 20 historiated main and medium initials on f. 1ra3-8 (Hirðskrá; King with sword), f. 24ra2-5 (Bréf Magnúss konungs (Bylov); King blessing), f. 24ra2-5 (Þingfararbolkr (Bylov); Hand blessing), f. 44va11-13 (Réttarbót Magnúss Eiríkssonar 9.3.1295; King blessing; Medium initial), f. 52ra2-6 (Kristinréttr yngri [G], ch. 1; Head of Christ), f. 61va4-9 (Bréf Magnúss konungs; King and Queen), f. 62va12-15 (Þingfararbolkr; Head of Christ), f. 66ra4-8 (Kristindómsbolkr; Christ in Majesty), f. 70ra16-21 (Landavarnarbolkr; Knight armed), f. 76ra1-6 (Mannhelgisbolkr; 2 figures arguing), f. 86ra1-6 (Erfðatal, Kvennagiftingar; 2 figures swearing), f. 88va18-23 (Erfðatal; 1 figure above, 3 figures below swearing), f. 94vb6-10 (Landabrigðabolkr, Ódalsskiptum; 2 figures swearing), f. 96va9-13 (Landabrigðabolkr, Landsleigu ok varnar; 1 figure swearing), f. 99rb7-11 (Landsleigubolkr; 2 human heads above, 1 gryllus figure below), f. 118rb3-8 (Kaupabolkr; 2 figures swearing), f. 125rb17-21 (Þjófabolkr; 1 hanged figure), f. 128rb6-9 (Réttarbót Hákonar Hákonarsonar in Landslog; King blessing; Medium initial), f. 128vb10-13 (Réttarbót Magnúsar Hákonarsonar in Landslog; Head of King; Medium initial), f. 130rb2-5 (Réttarbót Eiríks Magnússonar 1280; Head of King; Medium initial), f. 132va16-20 (Réttarbót Hákonar Magnússonar 28.6.1298; 2 rams; Medium initial). In addition, three unhistoriated ornamented medium initials are found on f. 26va5-10, f. 32va22-25 and f. 38rb1-5. Finally, on ff. 140-141, historiated scenes accompany the featured calendarium in the lower margins (Hunting with falcon for May, pulling weeds for June, ploughing for July, harvesting grain for August, harvesting fruits for Septemb er, sowing for Octover, butchering for November and brewing for December). Many of the minor and remaining medium initials are inhabited and feature human heads likely connected in one way or another to the introduced text sections.

Form of Initials: Ornamented and guilded large (15 lines) and medium initials (4 lines). Especially large initials are almost always extended into the margins.
Iconography: Eleven historiated initials with generally unhistoriated scens accompanying them in the margins / bas-de-page. The historiated initials are found on f. 1v1-19 (Bréf Magnús konungs; King and servant), f. 2v16-22 (Þingfararbolkr, ch. 1; Last Judgement), f. 6r5-21 (Kristindómsbolkr, ch. 1; King and bishop), f. 9r21-32 (Landvarnarbolkr, ch. 1; Three knights on a battleship), f. 15v1-18 (Mannhelgisbolkr, ch. 1; King hands out a chapter with attached seal), f. 24r8-25 (Erfðatal, ch. 1 / Kvennagiptingar; Wedding ceremony), f. 26r21-34 (Erfðatal, handover of inheritance), f. 32r12-29 (Landabrigðabolkr, ch. 1; Two figures share inheritance), f. 35r18-32 (Landsleigubolkr, ch. 1; Two figures shake hands), f. 51r1-15 (Kaupabolkr, ch. 1; Two figures engage in trade), f. 57r7-22 (Þjófabolkr, ch. 1; Prosecution of a thief).
